result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard E. Jorgensen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sex with Child Age 16 or Older, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.09.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Attorney Breanna Magallones and DA Michael William Schiek appering by video

03:48 PM Defendant Richard E.P. Jorgensen in court appearing telephonically with attorney Breanna Magallones appearing by video. Michael William Schiek appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 17CF147, 15CM377, 15CF05 & 15FO941. Magallones states all cases are for review of fines - would like to extend out - defendant has 2 new cases - defendant currently in Texas. Court states not able to take action in 17CF147 - Judge Stenz case - to set for clerks review. adj. 03:52 PM  Review hearing scheduled for June 9, 2020 at 03:30 pm.

03:17 PM Defendant Richard E. Jorgensen in court with attorney Breanna Magallones appearing for Mary L. Roth Burns.  Jillian Pfeifer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15CM377, 15CF05 & 15FO941. Magallones statement to incarceration and is seeking employment. Court review of payments. Court authorizes community service at $10/hour. adj. 03:20 PM  Review hearing scheduled for April 20, 2020 at 03:00 pm.

04:07 PM Defendant Richard E Jorgensen in court, in custody, appearing by video means.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15FO941, 18TR2995, 15CF5, 15CM377, 17CF147 & 17CM249. Court questions Defendant on incarceration/non-payment. adj. 04:11 PM  Review hearing scheduled for November 25, 2019 at 03:00 pm.

03:41 PM Defendant Richard E. Jorgensen in court.  Mary M Sowinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant appears on 15fo941,15cf5,15cm377,17cf147,17cm249,147fo96, - Total due yet is $2100.28
Defendant now has full time employment - Can pay $150/month - Court requires $150/month commencing 3-7-19 - but will be court supervised since violated payment plan in past.  Review hearing scheduled for July 29, 2019 at 03:00 pm.
Review hearing on February 4, 2019 at 03:00 pm.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 3:55 p.m. Defendant Richard E. Jorgensen in court, via video in custody.  Attorney Burns present in court. Jillian Pfeifer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant states he was out of custody for 2 months. Defendant has not paid costs. Burns statement - revoked last week; will be in ONSO until December, 2016. Court statement to defendant obtaining GED - defendant must do on own. Adj. 3:58 p.m.

3:39 pm. Defendant Richard E. Jorgensen in court, via video, in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant states that he has taken no steps to obtain GED - got out of jail in December - then grandmother died - Court instructs defendant to obtain info and obtain GED as soon as released from custody.  Review hearing scheduled for July 25, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

1:38 p.m. Defendant Richard E. Jorgensen in court, in custody, with attorney Mary Margaret Hogan.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Schiek/Hogan/Defendant/Court statement to sentencing. 
Court Sentence
Jail - 6 months with Huber for employment purposes
Jail credit - 80 days
Will allow day-for-day credit if successfully completes inpatient treatment.
Obtain GED prior to probation review date of March 14, 2016 at 3:30 
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO
Any monetary judgments related to this case are reduced to civil judgments
Appeal rights given.
Adj. 1:51 p.m.  Review hearing scheduled for March 14, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

11:44 am - Defendant Richard E. Jorgensen in court with attorney Mary Margaret Hogan.  Defendant Richard E. Jorgensen in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 15cf05, 15cf20, 14fo976 and 15cm07.    In 15cf05 and 15cf20 - Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over.  State files Information in 15cf05 and 15cf20.  In 15cf05 - State moves to amend to 948.09 a Class Misdemeanor - Sexual intercourse with a child - Granted.  In case 15cf20 - State moves to dismiss counts 2 and 3 - Granted.  State moves to dismiss 14fo976 and Count 2 in case 15cm07 - Granted.  Defendant pleads No Contest to remaining three counts.  Plea questionnaire filed.    Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty.  Schiek/Hogan/Court statement to sentencing. 
Court Sentence - Each Count Concurrent
WHS/POP 2 yrs
CC/DNA Surcharge/Supervision Fees
Attend Cognitive Thinking, if otherwise eligible
Obtain GED/HSED within first year of probation
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO
Appeal rights given
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery
no contact w/K.L.F. and no contact with any females under the age of 18 unless related by blood or marriage

01:38 pm - Defendant Richard E. Jorgensen in court with attorney Mary Margaret Hogan.  Defendant Richard E. Jorgensen in custody.  Michael W. Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, waive reading -set for preliminary hearing.  Schiek/Hogan to bond.  Court sets sig bond.  Hogan waives prelim time limits.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 20, 2015 at 11:00 am.
